p: Cytotoxic Concentration (CC 50) of CPC: Madin Darby canine kidney cells (MDCK, ATCC number CCL-34) were cultured at 37°C and in 5% CO 2 to 90% confluence in DMEM supplemented with penicillin/streptomycin, L-glutamine, and 10% fetal calf serum (Gibco, N.Y., USA). Increasing concentrations of CPC (10μg/mL to 250μg/ml, Sigma-Aldrich, St. Louis, MO) diluted in phosphate buffered saline (PBS) were added to media and incubated at room temperature for 10 minutes. Following exposure, cells were washed 3 times in DMEM to remove residual CPC. Complete media was then reapplied and cells were returned to 37°C, 5% CO 2. Viability was quantitated by neutral red uptake at 48 hours as previously described [ 30]. Toxicity data were used to determine the 50% cytotoxic concentration (CC 50, Prism; v6.0 software).
